content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler walks in and starts raiding the fridge. Then Rachel comes out of the shower with a towel wrapped round her waist, drying herself with another towel. Chandler and Rachel startle each other and she drops the towel for a second and snatches the rug off the couch.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That is IT! You just barge in here, you don’t knock

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m sorry!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You have no respect for anybody’s privacy!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Rachel, wait, wait.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, you wait! This is ridiculous!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Can I just say one thing?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? What?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s a relatively open weave and I can still see your… nipular areas.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh!!
(She storms off)

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is there with her boyfriend Roger, talking to Rachel and Monica.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, honey, honey, tell them the story about your patient who thinks things are, like, other things. Y’know? Like, the phone rings and she takes a shower.

content.speaker: Roger
content.text: That’s pretty much it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oops!

content.speaker: Roger
content.text: But you tell it really well, sweetie.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thanks. Okay, now go away so we can talk about you.

content.speaker: Roger
content.text: Okay. I’ll miss you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Isn’t he great?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: He’s so cute! And he seems to like you so much.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know, I know. So sweet… and so complicated. And for a shrink, he’s not too shrinky, y’know?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, you think you’ll do it on his couch?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I don’t know, I don’t know. I think that’s a little weird, y’know? Vinyl.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okaaay. (To the guys, on the couch) Any of you guys want anything else?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, yes, could I have one of those. (Points)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I’m sorry, we’re all out of those. Anybody else?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Roger
content.text: Did I, uh, did I miss something?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, she’s still upset because I saw her boobies.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You what? Wh what were you doing seeing her boobies?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It was an accident. Not like I was across the street with a telescope and a box of donuts.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, okay, could we change the subject, please?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, ’cause hello, these are not her boobies, these are her breasts.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, Pheebs, I was hoping for more of a change.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, I don’t know why you’re so embarrassed, they were very nice boobies.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Nice? They were nice. I mean, that’s it? I mean, mittens are nice.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okaaay, (Gestures) rock, hard place, me.

content.speaker: Roger
content.text: You’re so funny! He’s really funny! I wouldn’t wanna be there when when the laughter stops.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Whoah whoah, back up there, Sparky. What’d you mean by that?

content.speaker: Roger
content.text: Oh, just seems as though that maybe you have intimacy issues. Y’know, that you use your humour as a way of keeping people at a distance.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Huh.

content.speaker: Roger
content.text: I mean hey! I just met you, I don’t know you from Adam. …Only child, right? Parents divorced before you hit puberty.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uhhuh, how did you know that?

content.speaker: Roger
content.text: It’s textbook.
(Joey enters with his dad)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey you guys. Hey, you all know my dad, right?

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey! Hey, Mr. Trib!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, how long are you in the city?

content.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
content.text: Just for a coupla days. I got a job midtown. I figure I’m better off staying with the kid than hauling my ass back and forth on the ferry. (Sees Roger) I don’t know this one.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, this is my friend Roger.

content.speaker: Roger
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
content.text: Hey, hey. Good to meet you, Roger.

content.speaker: Roger
content.text: You too, sir.

content.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
content.text: What happened to the, uh, puppet guy?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dad, dad. (Shakes his head)

content.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
content.text: Oh, ’scuse me. So Ross, uh, how’s the wife? (Ross whines and lays his head on Chandler’s shoulder) Off there too, uh? Uh, Chandler, quick, say something funny!
(Chandler stays stonefaced)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Mr. Tribbiani is on the phone.

content.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
content.text: Gotta go. I miss you too, I love you, but it’s getting real late now

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Ma. Listen, I made the appointment with Dr. Bazida, and… Excuse me? (To his dad) Did you know this isn’t Ma?
(His dad nods. Cut to later. Joey is chopping mushrooms)

content.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
content.text: Her name’s Ronni. She’s a pet mortician.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure. So how long you been… (Goes back to chopping)

content.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
content.text: Remember when you were a little kid, I used to take you to the navy yard and show you the big ships?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Since then?!

content.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
content.text: No, it’s only been six years. I just wanted to put a nice memory in your head so you’d know that I wasn’t always such a terrible guy. …Joe. Y’ever been in love?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: …I d’know.

content.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
content.text: Then y’haven’t. You’re burning your tomatoes.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’re one to talk. (Puts the mushrooms in a saucepan)

content.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
content.text: Joe, your dad’s in love big time. And the worst part of it is, it’s with two different women.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh man. Please tell me one of ’em is Ma.

content.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
content.text: Of course, course one of ’em’s Ma. What’s the matter with you.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Joey is lamenting to everyone about hid dad’s affair.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s like if you woke up one day and found out your dad was leading this double life. He’s like actually some spy, working for the C.I.A. (Considers) That’d be cool… This blows!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know, I mean, why can’t parents just stay parents? (She walks over near Chandler and his gaze stays very obviously on her chest) Why do they have to become people? Why do they have… (Notices Chandler) Why can’t you stop staring at my breasts?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What? (Looks up) What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Did you not get a good enough look the other day?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Alright, alright. We’re all adults here, there’s only one way to resolve this. Since you saw her boobies, I think, uh, you’re gonna have to show her your peepee.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, I don’t see that happening?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: C’mon, he’s right. Tit for tat.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well I’m not showing you my ‘tat.’
(Door buzzer goes)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hello?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s Phoebe.

content.speaker: Roger
content.text: And Rog.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: C’mon up.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, good. Rog is here.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s the matter with Rog?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, it’s nothing, it’s a little thing… I hate that guy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What, so he was a little analytical. That’s what he does, y’know? C’mon, he’s not that bad.
(Cut to Chandler, Ross and Roger sitting at the table. Ross is upset)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’see, that’s where you’re wrong. Why would I marry her if I thought on any level thatthat she was a lesbian?

content.speaker: Roger
content.text: I dunno. Maybe you wanted your marriage to fail.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why? Why would I why? Why? Why? Why?

content.speaker: Roger
content.text: I don’t know. Maybe maybe low self-esteem, maybe maybe to compensate for overshadowing a sibling, maybe you…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait-wait, go back to that sibling thing.

content.speaker: Roger
content.text: Well, I don’t know. I mean, it’s conceivable that you wanted to sabotage your marriage so that the sibling would feel less of a failure in the eyes of the parents.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That that’s ridiculous! I don’t feel guilty for her failures!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh! So you think I’m a failure!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Isn’t he good?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nonono, thatthat’s not what I was saying…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know, all these years, I thought you were on my side. But maybe what you were doing was sucking up to Mom and Dad so they’d keep liking you better!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, I married a lesbian to make you look good!
(Cut to later. Rachel is in tears)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You’re right! I mean you’re right! It wasn’t just the Weebles, but it was the Weeble Play Palace, and and the Weebles’ Cruise Ship. Oh, which had this little lifeboat for the Weebles to wobble in.

content.speaker: Roger
content.text: That’s tough. Tough stuff. C’mon, Pheebs, we’re gonna catch that movie, we gotta get going.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, okay. Feel better, Rachel, ’kay?

content.speaker: Roger
content.text: Geez, we’re gonna be late, sweetie…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, okay. Listen, thanks for everything, Mon.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re welcome.

content.speaker: Roger
content.text: Listen guys, it was great seeing you again. Mon, um, easy on those cookies, okay? Remember, they’re just food, they’re not love.
(He shuts the door and Ross and Monica fling cookies at it)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hate that guy! (Throws another cookie)

content.description: The Hallway, Chandler and Joey are just leaving Monica and Rachel’s.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Night, you guys.
(They notice that a woman is sitting by their door)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh look, it’s the woman we ordered.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey. Can, uh, can we help you?

content.speaker: Ronni
content.text: Oh, no thanks, I’m just waiting for, uh, Joey Tribbiani.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m Joey Tribbiani.

content.speaker: Ronni
content.text: Oh no, not you, big Joey. Oh my God, you’re so much cuter than your pictures! (Joey stares at her) I-I’m, I’m Ronni…Cheese Nip?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, Joey’s having an embolism, but I’d go for a Nip, y’know?

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Ronni is talking to Chandler. Joey’s dad is not around.

content.speaker: Ronni
content.text: Now, y’see, most people, when their pets pass on, they want ’em sorta laid out like they’re sleeping. But occasionally you get your person who wants them in a pose. Like, chasing their tail, (Demonstrates) or, uh, jumping to catch a frisbee.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey, if I go first, I wanna be looking for my keys.

content.speaker: Ronni
content.text: That’s a good one!
(Joey’s dad enters.)

content.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
content.text: Hey, Joe.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dad, Ronni’s here.

content.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
content.text: Huh?

content.speaker: Ronni
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
content.text: Hey! Hello, babe! Wh what’re what’re you doing here?

content.speaker: Ronni
content.text: Oh, uh, well, you left your good hair at my apartment, I figured you’d need it tomorrow for your meeting. (Hands him the hair)

content.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
content.text: Thank you. Uh…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, who’s up for a big game of Kerplunk ?

content.speaker: Ronni
content.text: Look, I uh, I shouldn’ta come. I-I’d better get going, I don’t wanna miss the last train.

content.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
content.text: I don’t want you taking that thing.

content.speaker: Ronni
content.text: Oh, where’m I gonna stay, here?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Who-ah-ho.

content.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
content.text: We’ll go to a hotel.

content.speaker: Ronni
content.text: We’ll go to a hotel.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No you won’t.

content.speaker: Ronni
content.text: No we won’t.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: If you go to a hotel you’ll be…doing stuff. I want you right here where I can keep an eye on you.

content.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
content.text: You’re gonna keep an eye on us?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s right, mister, and I don’t care how old you are, as long as you’re under my roof you’re gonna live by my rules. And that means no sleeping with your girlfriend.

content.speaker: Ronni
content.text: Wow. He’s strict.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Now dad, you’ll be in my room, Ronni uh, you can stay in Chandler’s room.

content.speaker: Ronni
content.text: Thanks. You’re, uh, you’re a good kid.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: C’mon, I’ll show you to my room. …That sounds so weird when it’s not followed by “No thanks, it’s late.”

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. Now this is just for tonight. Starting tomorrow, you gotta make a change. This has gone on long enough.

content.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
content.text: What kinda change?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, either you break it off with Ronni

content.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
content.text: I can’t do that!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Then you gotta come clean with Ma! This is not right!

content.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
content.text: Yeah, but this is

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t wanna hear it! Now go to my room!

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, night. Chandler and Joey are sharing the sofabed in the living room. Joey is restless.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, Kicky. What’re you doing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Just trying to get comfortable. I can’t sleep in my underwear.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, you’re gonna.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’ve been thinking. Y’know, about how I’m always seeing girls on top of girls…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are they end to end, or tall like pancakes?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y’know what I mean, about how I’m always going out with all these women. And I always figured, when the right one comes along, I’d be able to be a stand-up guy and go the distance, y’know? Now I’m looking at my dad, thinking…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, you’re not him. You’re you. When they were all over you to go into your father’s pipe-fitting business, did you cave?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No. You decided to go into the out-of-work actor business. Now that wasn’t easy, but you did it! And I’d like to believe that when the right woman comes along, you will have the courage and the guts to say “No thanks, I’m married.”

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You really think so?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah. I really do.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks, Chandler. (Snuggles up to him)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Get off!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, morning. Someone knocks on the door and Monica gets it.

content.speaker: Ronni
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi…May I help you?

content.speaker: Ronni
content.text: Yeah, uh, Joey said I could use your shower, since, uh, Chandler’s in ours?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay…who are you?

content.speaker: Ronni
content.text: Oh, I’m Ronni. Ronni Rappelano? The mistress?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, c’mon in.

content.speaker: Ronni
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi, I’m Rachel.

content.speaker: Ronni
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Bathroom’s up there.

content.speaker: Ronni
content.text: Great.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, listen, Ronni, how long would you say Chandler’s been in the shower?

content.speaker: Ronni
content.text: Oh, like, uh, five minutes?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Perfect. Fasten your seatbelts, it’s peepee time. (She goes into Joey and Chandler’s apartment, where Mr. Tribbiani is reading the paper) Hey, Mr. Trib.

content.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
content.text: Hey. Morning, dear.
(Rachel goes up to the door of their bathroom)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Chandler Bing? It’s time to see your thing.
(She opens the door and whips back the curtain. It’s Joey. They both scream)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s the matter with you?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I thought it was Chandler!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What? What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You were supposed to be in there so I could see your thing!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sorry, my my thing was in there with me.

content.description: Central Perk, everyone is there as Phoebe enters.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey, Pheebs.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How’s it going?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Good. Oh oh! Roger’s having a dinner thing and he wanted me to invite you guys.
(Chandler laughs)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So what’s going on?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nothing, um, it’s just, um… It’s Roger.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I dunno, there’s just something about…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Basically we just feel that he’s…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We hate that guy.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yeah. Hate him.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We’re sorry, Pheebs, we’re sorry.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh. Okay. Okay, don’t you think, maybe, though, it’s just that he’s so perceptive that it freaks you out?

content.speaker: All
content.text: …No, we hate him.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We’re sorry.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s apartment, Joey is trying to turn the sofabed back into a sofa. Someone knocks on the door and it rears up at him.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ma! What’re you doing here?

content.speaker: Mrs. Tribbiani
content.text: I came to give you this (Gives him a bag of groceries) and this. (Whacks him round the ear)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oww! Big ring!

content.speaker: Mrs. Tribbiani
content.text: Why did you have to fill your father’s head with all that garbage about making things right? Things were fine the way they were! There’s chicken in there, put it away. For God’s sake, Joey, really. (She gives the sofabed a tiny push and it folds away)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hold on, you-you knew?

content.speaker: Mrs. Tribbiani
content.text: Of course I knew! What did you think? Your father is no James Bond. You should’ve heard some of his cover stories. “I’m sleeping over at my accountant’s,” I mean, what is that? Please!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So then how could you I mean, how could you?!

content.speaker: Mrs. Tribbiani
content.text: Do you remember how your father used to be? Always yelling, always yelling nothing made him happy, nothing made him happy, not that wood shop, not those stupid little ships in the bottle, nothing. Now he’s happy! I mean, it’s nice, he has a hobby.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ma, I don’t mean to be disrespectful, but… what the hell are you talking about?! I mean, what about you?

content.speaker: Mrs. Tribbiani
content.text: Me? I’m fine. Look, honey, in an ideal world, there’d be no her, and your father would look like Sting. And I’ll tell you something else. Ever since that poodle-stuffer came along, he’s been so ashamed of himself that he’s been more attentive, he’s been more loving… I mean, it’s like every day’s our anniversary.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m…happy…for you?

content.speaker: Mrs. Tribbiani
content.text: Well don’t be, because now everything’s screwed up. I just want it the way it was.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ma, I’m sorry. I just did what I thought you’d want.

content.speaker: Mrs. Tribbiani
content.text: I know you did, cookie. Oh, I know you did. So tell me. Did you see her?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. You’re ten times prettier than she is.

content.speaker: Mrs. Tribbiani
content.text: That’s sweet. Could I take her?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: With this ring? (Her engagement ring.) No contest.

content.description: Central Perk. Phoebe is there with Roger.

content.speaker: Roger
content.text: What’s wrong, sweetie?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Nothing, nothing.

content.speaker: Roger
content.text: Aaaah, what’s wrong, c’mon. (Pats his leg. She lies down and rests her head in his lap)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s, I mean, it’s nothing, I’m fine. It’s my friends. They-they have a liking problem with you. In that, um, they don’t.

content.speaker: Roger
content.text: Oh. They don’t.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But they don’t see all the wonderfulness that I see. They don’t see all the good stuff and all the sweet stuff. They just think you’re a little…

content.speaker: Roger
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Intense and creepy.

content.speaker: Roger
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But I don’t. Me, Phoebe.

content.speaker: Roger
content.text: Well, I’m not I’m not at all surprised they feel that way.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re not? See, that’s why you’re so great!

content.speaker: Roger
content.text: Actually it’s, it’s quite, y’know, typical behaviour when you have this kind of dysfunctional group dynamic. Y’know, this kind of co-dependant, emotionally stunted, sitting in your stupid coffee house with your stupid big cups which, I’m sorry, might as well have nipples on them, and you’re like all ‘Oh, define me! Define me! Love me, I need love!’.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Joey is letting everyone in on the new developments.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So you talked to your dad, huh.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. He’s gonna keep cheating on my ma like she wanted, she’s gonna keep pretending she doesn’t know even though she does, and my little sister Tina can’t see her husband any more because he got a restraining order…which has nothing to do with anything except that I found out today.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Things sure have changed here on Waltons mountain.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So Joey, you okay?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I guess. It’s just parents, after a certain point, you gotta let go. Even if you know better, you’ve gotta let them make their own mistakes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Just think, in a couple of years we get to turn into them.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: If I turn into my parents, I’ll either be an alcoholic blond chasing after twenty-year-old boys, or… I’ll end up like my mom.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey, Pheebs.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How’s it going?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, okay, except I broke up with Roger.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Awww.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, right.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Aaawwwwww!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What happened?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t know, I mean, he’s a good person, and he can be really sweet, and in some ways I think he is so right for me, it’s just… I hate that guy!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s. Phoebe is reading the paper and Joey enters.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, Joey. What’s going on?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Clear the tracks for the boobie payback express. Next stop: Rachel Green. (He goes into the bathroom. We hear a scream and he comes out, closely followed by Monica in a towel)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey!! What the hell were you doing?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sorry. Wrong boobies.
(He leaves. Cut to Monica entering Chandler and Joey’s apartment. She sneaks up to the shower door)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hello, Joey.
(She whips back the curtain to reveal Joey’s dad)

content.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
content.text: Oh! …Hello, dear. (She whips the curtain shut in horror)
